Dear Mr. Britt:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact Linda Tansil, Area Manager, at 734-775-8293.
Sincerely,
Douglas Turrill, Licensing Consultant

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CPA Rule 400.12206
Section (1) An agency shall require a staff member who has ongoing
Description contact with children or parents to be a person who has the ability,
experience, education, and training to perform the duties
assigned.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation It is alleged that a staff person pushed a youth down some stairs.
Investigation Youth A was interviewed face to face with another DHHS
Worker on April 5, 2023. Youth A is a 17-year-old male who
currently resides at Wolverine Center in Detroit. Youth A reported
that a couple of weeks ago when he resided in an independent
living home an unknown female and her baby were upstairs in the
home. Youth A reported he was upstairs with them when Staff 2
told the unknown female she needed to leave the premises. Youth
A reported that Staff 2 and the unknown female started to fight by
the unknown female’s car. Youth A reported he got into the
unknown female’s car, and they left and returned to the home
later. Youth A reported that there was a person outside the home
with a ski mask on and who had a gun in his pocket. Youth A
reported that there were three other people, one a young female
with a gun. Youth A reported he then left the car, went inside and
then came back out. Youth A reported that the police then arrived,
and they told the people to leave. Youth A reported that Staff 2
had called her “people” to back her up as the female with the baby
had been threatening. Youth A reported that Staff 1 had arrived to
the home. Youth A reported that Staff 1 was arguing with Youth C
2

and was saying he was going to teach white boy a lesson. Youth
A reported he was on the stairs as well as Youth C who was
behind him when Staff 1 was trying to get to Youth C. Youth A
reported that Staff 2 “was trying to go through me” while I was on
the stairs and Staff 1 tried to slam him over the stair railing. Youth
A reported he grabbed the railing and both he and Staff 1 fell to
the floor.
The agency Program Manager was interviewed face to face
with another DHHS Worker on April 6, 2023. The Program
Manager reported that an unknown female was in the independent
living house and Staff 2 told her she needed to leave and the she
would not leave and wanted to fight Staff 2. The Program
Manager reported that Staff 2 did not have a car and she called a
female cousin for support as the female with the baby would not
leave and was threatening. The Program Manager reported that
Staff 2 then called her and the unknown female left with two youth
and then came back in a different car.
The Program Manager reported she then called Staff 1 asking that
he go to the home. The Program Manager reported that a
neighbor had called the police who arrived to the home and they
subsequently told Staff 2 to leave the area. The Program Manager
reported that the youth in the home were trying to fight Staff 1 and
she heard this over the neighbors phone. The Program Manager
reported that Youth C had called other residents who were
upstairs to come down and fight Staff 1. The Program Manager
reported that residents on the stairs would not let Staff 1 upstairs
and Youth A shoved Staff 1 and he began to fall backwards when
he and Youth A fell.
The Program Manager denied that anybody had weapons during
the incidents.
The agency Chief Administrator was interviewed face to face
with another DHHS Worker on April 6, 2023. The Chief
Administrator reported the there was a unknown female in the
home who was not supposed to be there. Staff 1 came to the
house because the police were telling Staff 2 she needed to leave
the premises. The Chief Administrator reported that residents
were threatening Staff 2 and she called a relative for support. The
Chief Administrator reported that residents were “high” and were
threatening, in particular Youth A, who he stated is dangerous.
Regarding the incident between Staff 1 and Youth A the Chief
Administrator reported that Staff 1 was trying to go up the stairs
and Youth A was standing and leaning over Staff 1. The Chief
3

Administrator reported that Staff 1 started to fall and grabbed
Youth A and they then both fell. The Chief Administrator reported
that he did not see any injury marks on the youth.
Staff 1 was interviewed face to face with another DHHS
Worker on April 6, 2023. Staff 1 reported that the residents had a
female in the house. Staff 1 reported that when he arrived to the
house the unknown female “got in his face” and he told her to
leave and she did with a couple of the residents. Staff 1 reported
that he told Staff 2 to call the police if the unknown female
returned to the home. Staff 1 reported that he later received a call
from Staff 2 stating the unknown female had come back to the
house and the police were there and had told Staff 2 she needed
to leave the premises. Staff 1 reported that he went back to the
house and Staff 2 and the unknown female had left. Staff 1
reported that the Chief Administrator telephoned him and he went
outside to take the call and re-entered the house and all residents
were on the stairs and he could smell marijuana. Staff 1 reported
that the residents were trying to keep him from going upstairs as
he wanted to investigate where the marijuana was and who had it.
Staff 1 reported that he was trying to get past Youth A when Youth
A pushed him down a stair. Staff 1 reported that he then tried to
go up the stairs a second time. Staff 1 reported that Youth A then
tried to push him back down the stairs with force. Staff 1 reported
as he was falling backward he grabbed Youth A and they fell
together over the stair railing and onto the floor. Staff 1 reported
that he got up and called the police.
Regarding an allegation that Staff 1 had slammed a door on Youth
C’s head Staff 1 denied that this had happened. There were no
other witnesses to this alleged incident.
Staff 1 denied that any of the youth had injuries. Staff 1 reported
that he was treated for a bruised kidney that resulted from the fall.
Staff 2 was interviewed via telephone with the DHHS Worker
on April 28, 2023. Staff 2 reported that Youth A had an unknown
female with a infant in the house. Staff 2 reported that she told the
unknown female she had to leave the house and the unknown
female began swearing at her. Staff 2 reported that she called her
cousin for support, and she also called Staff 1 and the police and
they arrived at the same time. Staff 2 reported that the unknown
female left before the police and Staff 1 arrived. Staff 2 reported
that her cousin showed up but did not get involved in events that
were happening. Staff 2 reported that Staff 1 left the house after
talking with the residents. Staff 2 reported that the police also left
4

and soon after the unknown female returned. Staff 2 reported that
she called Staff 1 again and he returned, and they made the
unknown female leave. Staff 2 reported that the residents had
become agitated and were making threats to herself and Staff 1.
Staff 2 reported that the police were called again, and they could
not calm the residents down so the police told Staff 2 to leave the
premises. Staff 2 reported she left and Staff 1 remained at the
house.
Staff 2 reported that her cousin did not have a gun and that no
men or other people came with her to the house. Staff 2 reported
that her cousin never left her car which was parked across the
street.
Youth B was interviewed via telephone on June 2, 2023. Youth
B currently resides at Vista Maria. Youth B reported that when
Staff 2 had told the unknown female to leave the house and they
were arguing two female friends of Staff 2 and her boyfriend
showed up at the house. Youth B reported that they had knives, a
screwdriver, and a gun. Youth B reported that the weapons were
in their pockets but could be partially seen. Youth B reported that
Staff 2 had referred to the unknown male as her boyfriend. Youth
B reported the unknown male and two females left when the
police arrived.
Youth B reported that Staff 1 was in an argument with Youth C
and all the residents were on the stairs. Youth B reported that
during the argument Youth A stepped in between them as Staff 1
tried to get at Youth C. Youth B reported Youth A was on a stair
above Staff 1 when Staff 1 then grabbed Youth A's legs and Youth
A pushed Staff 1 off and they both fell onto the floor. Youth B
reported that Staff 1 then went upstairs to look for marijuana.
Youth C could not be located for an interview.
DOCUMENT REVIEW:
Video review. A review of the incident was conducted. Video
footage of the stairwell where the incident began is of poor quality
as it is dark. Staff 1 can be seen standing at the bottom of the
stairs and is attempting to go up the stairs. There appears to be
movement indicating a struggle when Staff 1 and Youth A are off
the stairs and fall to the floor. The struggle ends quickly and Staff
1 is observed to go up the stairs.
Agency Incident Reports:
5

An incident report dated March 2023, and written by Staff 1 was
reviewed. The report documents the following information. Staff 1
had walked back into the house and made the statement to the
youth, “So what y’all supposed to be jumping me?” Staff 1
instructed all youth to go upstairs but they refused. Staff 1 noticed
the smell of marijuana and wanted to do an upstairs room search.
As Staff 1 was trying to go upstairs Youth A was blocking his path.
Staff 1 tried to walk around Youth A and Youth A pushed him
down the stairs. Staff 1 then attempts to go upstairs again. Youth
A pushed him again and as he was falling he grabbed Youth A
and they fell over the stair railing. Youth A then got Staff 1 in a
headlock which he then broke the hold.
A second incident report dated March 20, 2023, and written by
Staff 1 was reviewed. When Staff 1 arrived at the home per the
instruction of the Program Manager he shortly received a call from
the Chief Administrator and took the call outside. Youth C opened
the door and Staff 1 instructs Youth C to close the door. Youth C
refused, then Staff 1 slammed the door shut, and subsequently
Youth C yelled to the other youth that Staff 1 had slammed the
door shut on his head.
An incident report dated March 20, 2023, written by Staff 2,
speaks to the unknown female found in a youths bedroom and her
instruction for the unknown female to leave the home and the
subsequent threats the unknown female made towards her. The
report does not offer any additional information which has not
been addressed in this investigation. A second report dated March
20, 2023, written by Staff 2, documents the unknown female
stating she was going to call her family. A third report written by
Staff 2 on March 20, 2023, documents that Youth A was making
threats about attacking Staff 1 should he arrive to the home as
Staff 2 informed Youth A she was calling Staff 1.
Police Report.
A police report dated March 20, 2023, was reviewed. The report
documents the events on the stairs as Staff 1 tried to go upstairs.
The report states that Staff 1 had told police he tried to force
himself upstairs and was pushed by Youth A and they began to
wrestle.
The police report documents that Youth A “had a bit of a swelling”
on the left side of his face and Youth C had a slight scratch on his
shoulder.
MDDHS Worker had findings in the investigation.
6

Analysis Staff 1 and 2 demonstrated an inability to perform their duties as
required by this rule. Program youth were escalated from earlier
encounters with Staff 1, Staff 2, and the police regarding the
unknown female and her encounter with Staff 2, as well as the
allegation that people arrived to the home with weapons. The
Program Manager also reported that she heard over the phone
that youth were defiant and trying to fight Staff 1. When Staff 1
was on the stairwell and was pushed by Youth A, Staff 1 then
attempted to go up the stairs a second time and was pushed
again by Youth A, they struggled and fell. The police report
documented that Staff 1 had told police he tried to force his way
up the stairs. Staff 1 should have retreated until escalated youth
had become regulated and calmed down.
Staff 1’s incident report documents that he said to youth, “So what
y’all supposed to be jumping me”, a statement that does conform
to known and practiced de-escalation techniques.
Youth A and Youth B reported that Staff 2 had called people
known to her and these people arrived to the home and had
weapons. Staff 2 denied that people with weapons had arrived to
support her and that only her cousin arrived and she sat in her car
across the street. Staff 2 should not have called for support other
than agency staff/supervisors and the police.
Conclusion VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
